discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The feature of Prisma SD-WAN that ensures high availability (HA) of network services is B. Active / active architecture. This architecture leverages the fail-to-wire capabilities and HA group technology of ION devices at a branch site to ensure continuous operation and maintain all services and forwarding paths in case of a device failure
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma-sd-wan/administration/prisma-sd-wan-branch-high-availability

questions.question_text: Which feature of Prisma SD-WAN ensures high availability (HA) of network services?

discussion.content:
A. Zero Trust.
Zero Trust: A Zero Trust approach to the cloud removes trust assumptions when users, devices and applications connect. A SASE solution will provide complete session protection, regardless of whether a user is on or off the corporate network.
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/what-is-sase#:~:text=Zero%20Trust%3A%20A%20Zero%20Trust,or%20off%20the%20corporate%20network.

Selected Answer: B
Zero Trust is not a component of SASE, while Threat Prevention is and protects user sessions

Zeto Trust is not a component of PANW SASE, it is a concept and a tool to that helps architect and build security policies. I would go instead with Threat Prevention which is an actual component of PANW SASE

Selected Answer: A
Would go for A on this

Selected Answer: A
Somewhat misleading this question but A is the only what is possible.

questions.question_text: Which component of the secure access service edge (SASE) solution provides complete session protection, regardless of whether a user is on or off the corporate network?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
Palo Alto Networks SASE (Secure Access Service Edge) provides a cloud-delivered architecture that enables:
B. Secure Private Application Access – Delivered via ZTNA 2.0, allowing users to securely access internal applications without exposing them to the public internet.
C. Secure Internet Access – Includes advanced threat prevention, URL filtering, DNS security, and other capabilities to protect users accessing public web resources.

D. Secure Phishing Access – Not a valid feature; phishing protection is part of secure internet access, but this is not a standalone offering.

Selected Answer: BC
B and C
Secure Private Application Access: This feature ensures secure access to private applications hosted in data centers or cloud environments, protecting them from unauthorized access
Secure Internet Access: This feature provides secure access to internet-based applications and services, ensuring that users are protected from web-based threats
- Copilot

Selected Answer: BC
private access and internet access

questions.question_text: Which two features does Palo Alto Networks SASE offer its customers? (Choose two.)

A net new customer has a hard requirement for Active Directory Groups while looking for an SSE solution in order to create policies against a group of users, as opposed to individual users.

Without external hardware, what will enable group mappings to be accomplished with Prisma Access natively?

A customer is concerned that they are not getting notifications of infrastructure upgrades.

Where should this customer look in Strata Cloud Manager to validate who is getting notified about infrastructure events?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is: B. Incidents & Alerts –> Notification Profiles
To validate or update who is receiving notifications about infrastructure upgrades or events, the customer should navigate to:

Incidents & Alerts → Notification Profiles
This section allows administrators to configure alert recipients, notification methods, and thresholds for different event types, including infrastructure upgrades performed by Palo Alto Networks.
